entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:09PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain and High Water Southeast Interior Rivers This Week... The area near the Alaska Range southeast of Tok will have an elevated risk of flooding through Thursday. entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Heavy rainfall of 6 to 8 inches has occurred over the Sucarnoochee River basin within the last 2 to 3 hours and a flood warning is now in effect for the Sucarnoochee River.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sumter

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 7:30AM CDT until July 13 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SUMTER COUNTY... At 730 AM CDT, Sumter County Emergency Management reported Flash Flooding ongoing in several locations throughout the county, including roads impassible and water going into homes in York. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen based on radar estimates.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sumter

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 12 at 10:03PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Possible Flash Flooding Friday night through Sunday... An active surface trough is anticipated to develop northeast of the territory by the end of the week. Flash flooding from this feature is possible as the trough lingers in the area Friday night through Sunday. Model solutions have been consistent in enhanced instability and moisture associated with the trough.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
